data.why:
A script and module for generating and maintaining identifiers
    suitable for applications ranging from persistent, globally
    recognized names -- ARKs, PURLs, URNs, LSIDs, etc. -- to short-lived
    compact sessions keys (cf. UUIDs). Generators are very fast,
    scalable, easy to create and tear down, and have a small footprint
    (they use BerkeleyDB as the underlying database).

meta.subject: PAUSE ID request (JAK; John A. Kunze)
